node.text:
@madeinhackney Made In Hackney opened its doors in 2012 as the UK’s first fully vegan community cookery school and charity.

They collaborate with communities to showcase and develop skills, knowledge and inspiration to grow, cook and eat more plants.

The kitchen started as a response to global and local crisis – health inequalities, food access and climate change. These interconnected issues drive their mission to bring about positive change in the areas of community, health and environment with delicious, culturally varied, nutritious plant-based food at the centre of all they do.

The heartbeat of their organisation is their cookery and food growing classes. These sessions are opportunities to come together, share skills and cultural cuisines, learn new ones, deepen community connection and inspire joyful and lasting behaviour change. The results of these gatherings are beautiful.

From curing type 2 diabetes, healing chronic bowel disorders, improving chronic fatigue symptoms, helping to manage depression, forming new friendships, starting a window ledge garden, gaining the skills and confidence to start a food business or learning to cook for the first time age 82 – the MIH family members unique journey’s after participating in their programmes never cease to amaze and inspire.

Find out more at https://madeinhackney.org/

node.text:
⚠️ Video contains graphic footage ⚠️

Whaling has taken place in the Faroe Islands for the past 1,000 years.

Every year, an annual hunt known as ‘the grind’ takes place between June - September at any one of the 26 designated killing bays around the islands.

On June 27th, @seashepherd crew witnessed 175 pilot whales be brutally killed in the name of this barbaric tradition. The dead included juveniles and pregnant females, who’s almost fully formed foetuses were discarded as trash.

Visit plnt.news/faroeislands (link in stories) to read more on this topic, or visit @seashepherd to find out how you can help put an end to it.

node.text:
Since @gretathunberg first appeared on the world’s stage, she has sounded the alarm over what will make Covid-19 look like a walk in the park. Climate breakdown is happening NOW.

People are not only quick to put Greta down, but speak of her in such unjustified and unforgivable ways.

Some of the following are examples of the narratives people believe;

✅ Greta is being controlled by the media
✅ Greta doesn’t write her own scripts and is a puppet
✅ George Soros made her
✅ Greta is a child and can’t possibly be thinking for herself

And then there are all the sexist, hateful, misogynistic commentary which we can not repeat. Most of these born out of a toxic sexist narrative from a society that can not understand how a young woman could be so intelligent. Greta is 18 years old. She is an adult.

If Greta was male, she wouldn’t receive a fraction of the hate she gets today. Society  pretends to be equal in how men and woman are treated, but that is simply not true. An illusion built and upheld by our patriarchal society. Women have been undermined, railroaded, gaslight, raped, abused, under-funded, under represented for centuries.

Greta’s message is one of extreme urgency, we are living on borrowed time. Our leaders have failed us. They need to start listening.

Or we are all f*cked.

Words by @robbie_lockie

node.title: Speaking Truth To Power Takes Guts

One from the archives, first published in 2018. All of these individuals have completely turned their life around thanks to a plant-based diet. With almost 1 million views on our YouTube, watch more in-depth videos like this one at youtube.com/PlantBasedNews

Featured in this video: 

10.Nina and Randa (@ninaandranda)
9.Josh Lajaunie (@joshlajaunie)
8.Will.I.Am (@iamwill)
7.Bianca Taylor (@biancataylorm)
6.Fiona Oakes (@oakes.fiona)
5.Hannah Howlett (@highcarbhannah)
4.Derek Simnett (@simnettnutrition)
3.Chef AJ (@therealchefaj)
2.Rich Roll (@richroll)
1.Joey Carbstrong (@joey_carbstrong)

node.text:
🔊SOUND ON 🔊
We are in the midst of an environmental emergency. Our forests are burning, our air is being polluted, our oceans are being poisoned, our soil degraded, and our wildlife wiped out. Never before in human history have we seen ecological devastation on this scale.  If we don’t act soon there won’t be a future to fight for.

Animal farming is at the heart of the climate crisis. Animal products provide just 18 per cent of calories while taking up 83 per cent of all farmland and produces 60 per cent of agriculture’s greenhouse gas emissions. We could reduce the use of farmland by over 75 per cent if we adopted a vegan diet. In 2018, the most comprehensive analysis of agriculture ever conducted, led by the University of Oxford, found overwhelmingly that the ‘single biggest way’ that individuals can protect the planet and our future is to adopt a vegan lifestyle.

The impact of eating animal products reaches far beyond the cow that you’re eating. It is contributing to the world’s sixth mass extinction and hurtling us towards a catastrophic temperature rise of up to 5°C by the end of this century.

Time is running out. Runaway climate change and habitat destruction have become THE most profound challenges of our age. We still have time left before we pass the point of no-return if we ACT NOW.

Going vegan is the single biggest thing you can do to cut down your environmental impact. Start your journey today.

Search Google for “Vegan Now” or follow @vivacharity to find out more.

node.text:
Our food system is collapsing around us, and some farming practices are destroying the precious soil we have left. It’s time to start focusing on solutions. 🌱

Watch @rosariodawson’s award-winning film, @theneedtogrow for free via this link 👉 plnt.news/needtogrow (clickable in IGTV) or swipe up on our stories!

node.text:
Dr Gemma Newman is a sparkling light in the medical field. She speaks from a point of knowledge and wisdom as well as making it easy to digest. The Plant Power Doctor is packed full of leading science in a very accessible way and lots of beautiful recipes too. -- David Flynn and Stephen Flynn The Happy Pear

Dr Gemma is delightful and whip-smart. May you be equal parts entertained and enlightened by her welcoming presence. -- Rich Roll

Dr Gemma is one of the few brave voices in the medical community who is experienced, courageous and confident enough to talk openly about food and its significance in preventing disease to save lives. What you choose to put on your plate is one of the most important health interventions and more plants is certainly the message we all need to hear. This book is a fantastic resource for people looking to improve their wellbeing and I'm personally inspired by Gemma's resilience and effort. -- Dr Rupy Aujla (Bestselling author and founder of The Doctor's Kitchen)

A must read for everyone. Food really can be medicine and Gemma shows you how. -- Dr Shireen Kassam (Consultant Haematologist, Founder of Plant Based Health Professionals UK)

Plant Power Doctor lays the foundation for a lifetime of good health and happiness - for both your mind and body. -- Rohini Bajekal (Nutritionist and Board-
Certified Lifestyle Medicine Professional)

An accessible resource, and one that is overflowing with practical, life-saving information. -- Brenda Davis (Research Dietitian)

Dr Newman is one of the few doctors who truly understands how to keep people healthy - instead of just treating them when they're sick. Her terrific Plant Power Doctor should be on the bookshelves of everyone who wants to live a longer, better life. -- Dan Buettner (New York Times Bestselling author of The Blue Zones)

Knowledge is power and so are plant-based foods! Thanks for making it so easy to understand. -- Derek Sarno (Wicked Kitchen co-founder and author)
One of a new wave of GPs who prescribe lifestyle changes as well as drugs. * The Telegraph *

node.title: The Plant Power Doctor - Dr Gemma Newman

node.text:
Join PBN cofounder @robbie_lockie for this quick LIVE with @nomeatathlete_official and @robert.cheeke to discuss their new book The Plant-Based Athlete. 

The book is 39% off for only $17.74! That price drop happened this morning on Amazon. 

The only research-based guide for connecting a plant-based diet with peak athletic performance, featuring interviews with professional athletes who've made the switch from meat to plants.

The Plant-Based Athlete by Matt Frazier and Robert Cheeke reveals the incontrovertible proof that the human body does not need meat, eggs, or dairy to be strong. Instead, research shows that a consciously calibrated plant-based diet offers the greatest possible recovery times, cell oxidation, injury prevention, and restorative sleep, and allows athletes to train more effectively, with better results.

However, committing to a plant-based diet as an elite athlete, first-time marathoner, or weekend warrior isn't as simple as swapping vegetables for meat. Even the slightest food adjustments can impact performance. That's why Matt Frazier, founder of No Meat Athlete, and Robert Cheeke, founder of Vegan Bodybuilding, wrote this groundbreaking book, to guide those interested in making this important shift in how to do so with the best, most transformative results.

The Plant-Based Athlete offers readers:

A persuasive body of evidence for adopting a plant-based lifestyle, with key information about how macronutrients, micronutrients, and calories fuel a body running on plant foods
An entire chapter devoted to protein - why plant sources of protein are preferable over meat, and how plant protein can be used to increase strength, muscle mass, and power
60+ delicious and nutritious plant-based recipes, including Veggie Burger Patties, Garden Meatballs, Summer Pasta Salad, Vegan Mac & Cheese, French Toast, Acai Bowl, and a High-Energy Smoothie
Insights from winning plant-based athletes in nearly every sport including champion ultrarunners Rich Roll and Scott Jurek; former NFL player David Carter; champion boxers Yuri Foreman, Unsal Arik, Cam Awesome, and Vanessa Espinoza; and Olympic-level swimmers, cyclists, figure skaters, sprinters, and more.

node.title: ❤️‍🔥BOOM! ❤️‍🔥 The Plant-Based Athlete IS OUT NOW!

node.text:
Globally, we produce about 1 million plastic bottles every minute, but what does that number even look like? Plastic bottle production is set to double in the next 20 years and quadruple by 2050. ⚠️

Coca-Cola is the #1 corporate plastic polluter, sign the petition to tell @cocacola that we DO NOT want plastic bottles. Get involved at 👉 humanitysimpact.com

This brilliant film by @StudioBirthplace made with @methodnmadness_ makes the invisible story visible, so we can better understand the overwhelming impact we humans have on our planet.

Accompanying the film is an augmented reality app made with @superposition.cc, also titled Humanity’s Impact in which you can experience the overwhelming data yourself! Download it for free on the app stores!

node.title: How Many Plastic Bottles Do We Really Produce?

Narration by Plant Based News @robbie_lockie

node.text:
British billionaire and investor Jim Mellon is certain the future will be free from the clutches of the meat, dairy and fish industries. His predictions are, in the next 10 years;

🥛 All dairy products will be gone
🥩 1/2 the world’s meat will be plant-based & cell based
🐟 1/2 the world’s fish will be cell-based 

The 64-year-old has helped create and support huge biotechnology companies, some of which aim to extend human life longevity. What are your predictions for the future of food? Let us know 👇

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on July 23, 2021. May be an image of food and text that says 'D PBN Eating Meat Raises Heart Disease Risk By A Fifth, New Study Finds'.

node.text:
Eating red and processed meat raises the risk of heart disease by a fifth, according to the largest ever analysis of research on the link between meat and heart disease.

Researchers at the University Of Oxford analyzed data from 13 cohort studies. In doing so, they tracked the health of more than 1.4 million people for up to 30 years.

The analysis unveiled that eating 50g of processed meat a day increases the risk of heart disease by 18%. Processed meat includes bacon, sausages, salami, ham, and beef jerky, among others.

Read the full article via the link in our bio

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Plant Based News on July 22, 2021 tagging @vegan. May be an image of fruit and text that says 'PBN IF He DOESN'T RESPECT THAT YOU'RE VEGAN LET THAT WORLD OF VEGAN'.

node.text:
Happy #nationalmangoday! Let that Man-go! 🤣 ... ⠀
⠀
But seriously, in the words of @MichelleCehn “it can be frustrating when you’ve totally fallen in love with the #plantbased lifestyle but your partner isn’t on board. But remember that YOU weren’t always vegan, and you were given the time and space to find that path on your own.⠀
⁣⠀
But there’s a big difference between a partner who isn’t vegan and one who doesn’t respect your choice to be vegan. When you REALLY love and care for someone, you support them and what they care about. I’ve been in a relationship with someone who made me feel bad about being vegan and how my choice inconvenienced him, and that dynamic was not healthy. You deserve someone who lifts you up and respects you and your passions. That’s my perspective anyway! Feel free to share yours below.” ⁣⠀
⁣⠀
📸 @vegan

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Plant Based News on July 22, 2021 tagging @harveylewisultrarunner. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'WOR TOUG W TO PBN S DWATER WATER VORLD'S OUGHES 2XU Run Uest TrAyoI Vegan Athlete Wins 'World's Toughest Race' For The Second Time 35 ATE LD' GHES'.

node.text:
Vegan ultrarunner Harvey Lewis just snagged first place in this year’s Badwater 135. Lewis has previously credited his plant-based diet for his boosted athletic performance – especially his endurance.

The Badwater 135 is known as ‘the world’s toughest foot race’. It spans 135mi. (217km) and features massive slopes. The start line is at Badwater Basin, Death Valley, which, at 85m below sea level, is the lowest elevation in North America. The finish line is at Whitney Portal, which is the highest point in the contiguous United States at 2530m.

The race includes three mountain ranges, covering 4450m of cumulative vertical ascent, and 1859m of cumulative descent.
Forty-five year old Lewis was the first to cross the finish line this year, completing in 25:50:23 and 100°F heat. It’s the second time the vegan athlete has won the event.

Lewis has completed the race 10 times, made the podium in five of them, and won the 2014 Badwater race.

Swipe 👉 to see Harvey crossing the finish line!

📷 @harveylewisultrarunner 

Tap the link in our bio and then again on this image to read the full story.

node.text:
Today is National Junk Food Day! 🍔 🍕 🍦 🍰 🍟 🍗 

While we all know a whole food plant-based diet is the healthiest, it’s fine to indulge in a (vegan) burger, pizza, or ice cream every now and again…Or every day, if that’s your thing! No judgment here 🤣. 

These foods are also great to help people reduce their meat consumption by replacing them with realistic alternatives 🙌 Share this with a friend who things vegans just eat salad! 🥗 

🎥: @giuseppefederici1

node.text:
⚠️ WARNING: Distressing footage ⚠️

Europe is experiencing some of the worst flash flooding in decades. Over 200 people have died and close to 1,000 people have suffered injuries because of flooding in Belgium, Germany, the Netherlands, and Switzerland.

In some areas, more than 1,000 people are still missing.

In China, 200,000 people were forced to evacuate due to separate flooding catastrophes. People have been trapped in railway tunnels with water up to their necks, and stranded on the rooftops of houses.

In Zhengzhou, the equivalent of a year’s average rainfall has fallen in just three days. Forecasters say it’s the region’s heaviest rainfall in 1,000 years.

Homes have been destroyed, and countless wild animals have suffered injuries, loss of habitat, and death.

Flooding is caused by multiple factors. But the climate crisis makes extreme weather events more likely, more frequent, and more severe.

Animal agriculture is a leading cause of deforestation, biodiversity loss, land and water degradation, pollution, and huge increases in greenhouse gas emissions. All of these factors accelerate the climate crisis.

In 2019, the world’s most comprehensive analysis of farming’s impact on the planet found that a vegan diet is ‘the single biggest way to reduce your impact on planet Earth’.

Videos spotted on @karmagawa

node.text:
Today is National Junk Food Day (US), and one of the most popular foods in a lot of junk is CHEESE! 🍕 🧀 - So here’s PBN’s @klaus0m dropping some truth bombs on why you should give it up for good! ❌

Find out more about the health benefits of a plant-based diet here 👉 https://plnt.news/vegan-healthy

Sources (there are many but here are a few): 

1) J Natl Cancer Inst. 2013 May 1; 105(9): 616–623.

2) International Journal of Epidemiology, Volume 49, Issue 5, October 2020, Pages 1526–1537 (contains the percentage increase mentioned)

3) Curr Dev Nutr. 2017 Mar; 1(3): e000422.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on July 19, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'PBN Plant-Based Diet Linked Το 84% Drop In Menopausal Symptoms'.

node.text:
A new study has connected dietary changes to the improved symptoms of menopause. Researchers discovered a vegan diet rich in soy reduces the number of vasomotor symptoms, including hot flashes, for menopausal women.⠀
⠀
The research was published by the North American Menopause Society in the journal Menopause.⠀
⠀
The study divided up postmenopausal women who experience two or more hot flashes a day into two groups. The intervention group consumed a low-fat, plant-based diet. The daily diet also included a half-cup of soybeans added to a soup or a salad.⠀
⠀
Meanwhile, the control group kept their regular eating habits for 12 weeks.⠀
⠀
Researchers recorded the frequency and severity of physical, vasomotor, psychosocial, and sexual symptoms.⠀
⠀
Tap the link in our bio and then again on this image to read the full story.⠀
⠀
https://plantbasednews.org/lifestyle/women/plant-based-diet-menopausal-symptoms/

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on July 19, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Healthy Plant-Based ased Diet Cuts COVID-19 Risk, New Study Reveals V PBN'.

node.text:
A recent study has revealed eating a plant-based diet rich in whole foods can help protect against COVID-19.⠀
⠀
And the staggering results indicate those on a ‘high quality’ healthy vegan diet were both less likely to catch the virus, and less likely to be hospitalized with it.⠀
⠀
Top researchers at Havard Medical School and King’s College London collated data from almost 600,000 individuals.⠀⠀
⠀
Those with a high-quality score contained swathes of plant-based whole foods from fruits and vegetables to whole grains. Moreover, the best-rated diets contained fewer processed foods and refined carbohydrates.⠀
⠀
Tap the link in our bio and then again on this image to read the full story.

node.text:
Why don’t vegans eat eggs? 🍳🐣

Here’s one reason why - In the egg industry, male chicks are either ground up alive in a macerator or gassed to death shortly after they hatch. This is because they are considered useless because they cannot lay eggs. No profit is to be made from these male chicks, so they are discarded as if they were trash. 

Please choose plant-based egg alternatives to stop this from happening.

Video by: @thesavemovement
